trans-unit.source: Represents the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) <xref uid="langword_csharp_annotation" name="annotation" href=""></xref> element.

An `annotation` element can contain one or more <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaAppInfo> instances (information for applications) and <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDocumentation> instances (comments or text for humans).
An annotation is used to store extra information about the schema or its elements.
These notes are specified for human consumption, `xs:documentation`, or by software, `xs:appinfo`.
Annotation can be the first element of most schema elements or anywhere under the schema element.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaAnnotation"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the string id.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_String.Empty" name="String.Empty" href=""></xref>.

Gets the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Items" name="Items" href=""></xref> collection that is used to store the <xref uid="langword_csharp_appinfo" name="appinfo" href=""></xref> and <xref uid="langword_csharp_documentation" name="documentation" href=""></xref> child elements.
An annotation can contain <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaAppInfo> (information used by applications) or <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaDocumentation> (comments or text used by humans).

An <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaObjectCollection"></xref> of <xref uid="langword_csharp_appinfo" name="appinfo" href=""></xref> and <xref uid="langword_csharp_documentation" name="documentation" href=""></xref> child elements.
Gets or sets the qualified attributes that do not belong to the schema's target namespace.
An array of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlAttribute"></xref> objects that do not belong to the schema's target namespace.
